intro: Thalictrum minus proles billotii, commonly known as the lesser meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a slender, herbaceous stem and produces numerous stamens in its flower clusters. Thalictrum minus proles billotii is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
